intro: Cryptocarpus paniculatus, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in panicles. The plant has glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely on the stems. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its showy blooms and adaptability to various soil types. The fruit is a small, capsule-like structure that contains several seeds.
